text: just how many died in June 1989 near
Tiananmen Square remains a mystery but
some facts from the chaotic showdown
between protesters and soldiers are
becoming clear sixteen hundred people
received prison sentences just one is
thought to remain behind bars we don't
have a photo of the last Tiananmen
prisoner but we know his name
Miao do Xuan a factory worker he was
convicted of arson his crime throwing a
basket at a burning tank it was a quiet
person
it was often very depressed this man
once shared a prison cell with me out
both received a suspended death
sentences the cause of that we were
supposed to have our feet in shackles
and I was locked up but he wasn't he
said the guards probably thought he was
too thin to be able to wear food chains
many believe me al hasn't been released
because he refused to admit guilt or
regret to find me elder Xu and we drove
to the far reaches of Beijing to
yenching prison an institution for
elderly and mentally ill inmates
we've been driving through the mountains
for the past few hours so we're only
getting close to the prison now
technically we're still in Beijing but
it certainly feels as if the Chinese
government has banished the last
prisoner meow too soon to another world
far away from the politics Tiananmen
Square
eventually we found the prison in a
remote stretch of countryside prison
authorities refuse to confirm anything
about me elder shunn but he's probably
living behind these walls according to
most who knew him that group includes
Jong bout soon another Tiananmen convict
who like Miao served years in prison for
arson
University students initiated the
protests in 1989
John believes that poor factory workers
receive the toughest punishments no one
spoke up for ordinary people like us
Wong dad one of the protest organizers
was only sentenced to four years in
prison because he had connections now
riddled with arthritis Jang is
struggling to establish a new life for
himself but he's grateful for the chance
to rejoin society he's well aware that
leal deshaun isn't scheduled for release
until September 2018 silly hat in BBC
News Beijing
